intro: Negria melicoides, commonly known as the white-flowered negria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white petals and hairy stems. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline conditions. Its flowers bloom in the summer and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
